% Defining custom colors for title and headers using HTML hex
\usepackage{xcolor}
\definecolor{TitleColor}{HTML}{2E74B5}   % Dark blue for title
\definecolor{HeaderColor}{HTML}{4F81BD}  % Medium blue for headers

% Customizing hyperlinks colors in PDF
\usepackage{hyperref}
\hypersetup{
    colorlinks=true,
    linkcolor=HeaderColor,
    urlcolor=HeaderColor,
    citecolor=HeaderColor
}

% Title formatting
\usepackage{sectsty}
\sectionfont{\color{HeaderColor}\Large\bfseries}
\subsectionfont{\color{HeaderColor}\large\bfseries}

% Style the auto-generated TOC and force it to a new page
\usepackage{tocloft}
\renewcommand{\cfttoctitlefont}{\hfill\Large\bfseries\color{HeaderColor}\vspace*{1cm}}
\renewcommand{\cftaftertoctitle}{\hfill\vspace{0.5cm}}
\renewcommand{\contentsname}{Table of contents}
\renewcommand{\cftsecfont}{\normalfont\color{HeaderColor}}
\renewcommand{\cftsubsecfont}{\normalfont\color{HeaderColor}}
\renewcommand{\cftsecpagefont}{\normalfont\color{HeaderColor}}
\renewcommand{\cftsubsecpagefont}{\normalfont\color{HeaderColor}}

% Force TOC to appear on its own page
\let\oldtoc\tableofcontents
\renewcommand{\tableofcontents}{%
    \clearpage
    \phantomsection
    \addcontentsline{toc}{section}{\contentsname}
    \oldtoc
    \clearpage
}

% Fancy header/footer
\usepackage{fancyhdr}
\pagestyle{fancy}
\fancyhf{}
\renewcommand{\headrulewidth}{0pt}
\rfoot{\thepage}

% Title style
\usepackage{titling}
\pretitle{\begin{center}\Huge\bfseries\color{TitleColor}}
\posttitle{\par\end{center}\vskip 0.5em}

% Document formatting
\usepackage{geometry}
\geometry{margin=1in}
\usepackage{setspace}
\onehalfspacing

% Additional packages
\usepackage{booktabs}
\usepackage{graphicx}
